intro: Impatiens tienmushanica var. tienmushanica, commonly known as the Tienmushan Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the genus Impatiens in the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, with a distinctive spurred petal that aids in pollination by insects. The leaves are ovate and hairy, contributing to its adaptability in its natural habitat.
